chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall a b q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> gcdZ r b = gcdZ b a

Premises:
Inductive Z : Set := OZ : Z | pos : nat -> Z | neg : nat -> Z Arguments pos _%nat_scope Arguments neg _%nat_scope
is_diveuclZ = fun a b q r : Z => b <> OZ /\ leZ OZ r /\ ltZ r (absZ b) /\ a = addZ (multZ b q) r : Z -> Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop
gcdZ = fun a b : Z => pi1 Z (is_gcdZ a b) (gcdZ_exists a b) : Z -> Z -> Z
gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
divexZ : forall a b q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
Inductive is_gcdZ : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop := gcd_OZ : forall b : Z, is_gcdZ OZ b (absZ b) | gcd_mod : forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> is_gcdZ b a d
is_gcdZ_ind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> Prop, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
is_gcdZ_sind : forall P : Z -> Z -> Z -> SProp, (forall b : Z, P OZ b (absZ b)) -> (forall b a d q r : Z, b <> OZ -> is_diveuclZ a b q r -> is_gcdZ r b d -> P r b d -> P b a d) -> forall z z0 z1 : Z, is_gcdZ z z0 z1 -> P z z0 z1
Inductive diveuclZ (a b : Z) : Set := divexZ : forall q r : Z, is_diveuclZ a b q r -> diveuclZ a b
BinInt.Z.div_unique : forall a b q r : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 r /\ BinInt.Z.lt r b \/ BinInt.Z.lt b r /\ BinInt.Z.le r BinNums.Z0 -> a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b q) r -> q = BinInt.Z.div a b
diveuclZ_ind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Prop), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rec : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Set), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_sind : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> SProp), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
diveuclZ_rect : forall (a b : Z) (P : diveuclZ a b -> Type), (forall (q r : Z) (i : is_diveuclZ a b q r), P (divexZ a b q r i)) -> forall d : diveuclZ a b, P d
gcdZ_is_gcdZ : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> d = gcdZ a b
Inductive diveucl (a b : nat) : Set := divex : forall q r : nat, b > r -> a = q * b + r -> diveucl a b Arguments diveucl (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments divex (_ _ _ _)%nat_scope
diveucl_rec : forall (a b : nat) (P : diveucl a b -> Set), (forall (q r : nat) (g : b > r) (e : a = q * b + r), P (divex a b q r g e)) -> forall d : diveucl a b, P d
divZ : forall a b : Z, b <> OZ -> diveuclZ a b
BinIntDef.Z.modulo = fun a b : BinNums.Z => let (_, r) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in r : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.modulo (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.div_opp_l_nz : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.modulo a b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.div (BinInt.Z.opp a) b = BinInt.Z.sub (BinInt.Z.opp (BinInt.Z.div a b)) (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH)
BinInt.Z.div_mod : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> a = BinInt.Z.add (BinInt.Z.mul b (BinInt.Z.div a b)) (BinInt.Z.modulo a b)
BinInt.Z.div_small_iff : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.div a b = BinNums.Z0 < -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 a /\ BinInt.Z.lt a b \/ BinInt.Z.lt b a /\ BinInt.Z.le a BinNums.Z0
BinInt.Z.mod_div : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.div (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) b = BinNums.Z0
BinNat.N.mul_mod_distr_r : forall a b c : BinNums.N, b <> BinNums.N0 -> c <> BinNums.N0 -> BinNat.N.modulo (BinNat.N.mul a c) (BinNat.N.mul b c) = BinNat.N.mul (BinNat.N.modulo a b) c
unicity_is_gcdZ : forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcdZ a b d1 -> is_gcdZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1
gcdZ_is_gcd : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d
gcd_unicity_apart_sign : forall a b d1 d2 : Z, is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d1 -> is_gcd Z IdZ multZ OZ a b d2 -> d2 = d1 \/ d2 = oppZ d1
positive_is_gcdZ : forall a b d : Z, is_gcdZ a b d -> leZ OZ d
BinIntDef.Z.div = fun a b : BinNums.Z => let (q, _) := BinIntDef.Z.div_eucl a b in q : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.div (_ _)%Z_scope
BinInt.Z.mod_bound_or : forall a b : BinNums.Z, b <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) /\ BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) b \/ BinInt.Z.lt b (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) /\ BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) BinNums.Z0
gcdZ_i : forall a b x : Z, is_gcdZ a b x -> {x : Z | is_gcdZ a b x}
P = fun a : Z => forall b : Z, have_gcdZ a b : Z -> Set
BinInt.Z.divide_mul_split : forall n m p : BinNums.Z, n <> BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.divide n (BinInt.Z.mul m p) -> exists q r : BinNums.Z, n = BinInt.Z.mul q r /\ BinInt.Z.divide q m /\ BinInt.Z.divide r p
BinInt.Z.mod_neg_bound : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt b BinNums.Z0 -> BinInt.Z.lt b (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) /\ BinInt.Z.le (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) BinNums.Z0
BinInt.Z.mod_pos_bound : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.lt BinNums.Z0 b -> BinInt.Z.le BinNums.Z0 (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) /\ BinInt.Z.lt (BinInt.Z.modulo a b) b
gcdZ_exists : forall a b : Z, have_gcdZ a b
gcdZ_correct : forall a b : Z, is_gcdZ a b (gcdZ a b)
have_gcdZ = fun a b : Z => {d : Z | is_gcdZ a b d} : Z -> Z -> Set
BinInt.Z.gcd_divide_r : forall a b : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide (BinInt.Z.gcd a b) b
integrityZ = fun a b : Z => Z_rec (fun a0 : Z => multZ a0 b = OZ -> {a0 = OZ} + {b = OZ}) (fun _ : multZ OZ b = OZ => left eq_refl) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (pos n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_posZ n b H)) (fun (n : nat) (H : multZ (neg n) b = OZ) => right (tech_integ_negZ n b H)) a : integrity Z multZ OZ
tech_div3 : forall n0 n q r : nat, S n0 = q * S n + r -> S n > r -> neg n0 = addZ (multZ (pos n) (neg q)) (pos (n - r))
tech_div6 : forall n0 n q r : nat, S n0 = q * S n + r -> S n > r -> neg n0 = addZ (multZ (neg n) (pos q)) (pos (n - r))
tech_div4 : forall n0 n q r : nat, S n0 = q * S n + r -> pos n0 = addZ (multZ (neg n) (negOZ q)) (posOZ r)

``` 
intros a b q r H1 H2.
apply gcdZ_is_gcdZ.
apply is_gcdZ_sind.
- intros b0. apply gcd_OZ.
- intros b0 a0 d q0 r0 H3 H4 H5 IH. apply gcd_mod; auto.
  apply divexZ; auto.
    exact (proj1 H5).
    exact (proj1 (proj2 H5)).
    exact (proj1 (proj2 (proj2 H5))).
    symmetry. exact H4.
Qed.
```

original: intros a b q r H1 H2. apply gcdZ_is_gcdZ. apply is_gcdZ_sind. - intros b0. apply gcd_OZ. - intros b0 a0 d q0 r0 H3 H4 H5 IH. apply gcd_mod; auto. apply divexZ; auto. apply (proj1 H5). apply (proj1 (proj2 H5)). apply (proj1 (proj2 (proj2 H5))). symmetry. apply H4.
